intro: Haumaniastrum dilunguense, commonly known as the Lujan's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including insects and mammals. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Haumaniastrum dilunguense typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its deep root system.
